content.description: A student wants to use an apparatus similar to system <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to measure the acceleration due to gravity <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the mass of the block, the force constant of the spring, and the angle of the incline are known, what additional data must be measured to determine an experimental value for <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>I.</mtext></mrow></math> The stretch of the spring at the equilibrium position<math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>II.</mtext></mrow></math> The speed of the block as it passes the equilibrium position<math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III.</mtext></mrow></math> The time interval between two consecutive passes through the equilibrium position

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
